New Year New Me.name: Verginia Johnny
New Year New Me.reply: Woww very educative. This is sooooo me. Mine is bad yo the extent my mum nicknamed me mother of twins, that the way I keep Turning up and down the house before leaving, there's no way I won't give birth to twins. During my internships, I receive every applaud except for punctuality. So I decided to set my clock each day at 5:30 am. So that I can at least wake up at 6 am and it's been working for me. It's unthinkable to sleep half your existence in life.

New Year New Me.name: Verginia Johnny
New Year New Me.reply: Punctuality is what every young person has to be conscious of. I really had and I'm still fighting this punctuality issue. The highest problem I have in life is sleeping early or waking up early, so I decided to break the bad habits by setting an alarm for 5:30 am each day. It doesn't matter if I sleep late, I must wake up at that time even if it means punishing myself. Thanks a million times for encouraging me and other followers who suffer from this bad habit and others

New Year New Me.name: Shanceline lum
New Year New Me.reply: There are really some habits that we consider little and give excuses to justify them but they end up destroying us, am glad to see someone who can make a resolution and stick to it, it's not actually easy but God will always give us strength to carry on

Things Fall Apart.name: Sylvia Wohlfarth
Things Fall Apart.reply: Things Fall Apart. Thank you for reminding me of this great book by Chinua Achebe, my father‚Äôs fellow countryman. I read it in my youth, superficially. I read it in my forties, awestruck and angered. I‚Äôll be reading it again, in my sixties, with reverence. 'The fact that some of the clans men weren‚Äôt united to a common cause also contributed to their downfall.' And continues to contribute to the story of Nigeria.

Oh, no. There goes the eye candy!.name: Nicole Henley
Oh, no. There goes the eye candy!.reply: Great article Bee! While I do agree that everyone should get to wear what he or she wants to wear, when he or she wants to, they should also always take into consideration the appropriateness of their outfit for the occasion. What you wear at what event shows how well you take the situation. Whether that be dressing smartly for the office shows you take your job seriously, in a bikini for the beach indicates that you are there to have the most fun, etc.‚Ä¶How you dress also shows how comfortable and confident with yourself. For the women who do dress provocatively, they do tend to exude very high confidence. That is not to say that women who do aren‚Äôt, just that some can be good at their job and still choose to have fun while they are at it. Like I said, in the end, everyone is allowed to wear what he or she wants when he or she wants. Keeping that mind, they should also know when to dress appropriately when the situation might call for it. (e.g., no mini-skirts when in court, no bikinis at funerals, no bike shorts at work, and the like).

Transitioning from a 9-5 Job to Becoming.name: Terry Banks
Transitioning from a 9-5 Job to Becoming.reply: Good article, thanks for sharing. I have just one problem which is in the first paragraph, you wrote ‚Äúbut it is a work in progress which I suspect will take a few years.‚Äù I think ‚ÄúExpect‚Äù in place of ‚ÄúSuspect‚Äù is a more suitable word to use, business is not classic gambling, though one has to be daring at times with his/her choices. ‚ÄúSuspect‚Äù could be so distracting to some readers, because it doesn‚Äôt signify certainty. It also doesn‚Äôt reflect the enthusiastic nature of the writer.

Transitioning from a 9-5 Job to Becoming.name: Ameaka

Marvel's Black Panther.name: Soob
Marvel's Black Panther.reply: I thought the film was visually stunning, and even better now learning about the specific aspects of African cultures it's based on - thank you! I saw it with a white British friend of mine and he seemed embarrassed to enjoy it, like he felt wrong about ogling the African-ness for entertainment or something. :-S One critique I'd make about the film - did stopping the shipment of weapons imply that all the Africans in the world are 'the bad guy'?! I'd like to think that even if the shipment got through, it wouldn't inevitably lead to all-out war, and something more nuanced would've happened. I'm not sure.

Marvel's Black Panther.name: MohManyang
Marvel's Black Panther.reply: @Soob I agree with you about the shipment of weapons. On its own, i don't think it would have led to all out war. If war ensued it would have been a contributing factor but not the sole cause
